name: Decimal

unions.name: Decimal
unions.comment:
The Decimal data type
It is represented as mantissa \* 10 ^ exponent

values.name: abs
values.comment: Absolute value (sets the sign as positive)

values.name: fastdiv
values.comment: Fast and dirty division. Don't expect too much precision from this division. Dividing by zero is bad, and Nothing will be returned.

values.name: fromFloat
values.comment: Converts a Float to a Decimal

values.name: fromInt
values.comment: Converts an Int to a Decimal

values.name: fromIntWithExponent
values.comment: Converts an Int to a Decimal, but specifying the exponent

values.name: fromString
values.comment: Converts a String to a Maybe Decimal. The string shall be in the format [<sign>]<numbers>[.<numbers>][e<numbers>]

values.name: getDigit
values.comment:
Gets the specified digit from a Decimal. The digits are:
0 -> units
1 -> tens
2 -> hundreds
and so on
-1 -> tenths
-2 -> hundredths
and so on

values.name: negate
values.comment: Changes the sign of a Decimal

values.name: round
values.comment: Rounds the Decimal to the specified decimal places

values.name: toFloat
values.comment: Converts a Decimal to a Float

values.name: toString
values.comment: Converts a Decimal to a String

values.name: truncate
values.comment: Truncates the Decimal to the specified decimal places
